py_sim.sensors.occupancy_grid module¶

occupancy_grid.py Stores the classes and defs for interacting with an occupancy grid

class py_sim.sensors.occupancy_grid.BinaryOccupancyGrid(res: float, x_lim: tuple[float, float], y_lim: tuple[float, float])¶

Bases: object

Stores a binary occupancy grid

FREE¶

Boolean indicating that a location is free of obstacles

Type:

bool

OCCUPIED¶

Boolean indicating that a location is occupied

Type:

bool

res¶

Resolution of the occupancy grid

Type:

float

x_lim¶

min and max x-values

Type:

tuple[float, float]

y_lim¶

min and max y-values

Type:

tuple[float, float]

tl_corner¶

Location of the top-left corner

Type:

TwoDimArray

n_cols¶

Number of columns in the grid

Type:

int

n_rows¶

Number of rows in the grid

Type:

int

grid¶

Binary grid storing the occupancy

Type:

NDArray[bool]

max_index¶

Stores the maximum scalar index of the grid

Type:

int

FREE: bool = False¶
OCCUPIED: bool = True¶
free_index(ind: int) → bool¶

Returns true if the index is valid and corresponds to an obstacle free location

free_subscripts(row: int, col: int) → bool¶

Returns true if the row and column indices are valie and the resulting cell is obstacle free

get_cell_box(row: int, col: int) → tuple[list[float], list[float]]¶

Defines the bounding box for a cell given by the row and column indices

Parameters:

  • row – Index for the grid row

  • col – Index for the grid column

Returns:

(x_vec, y_vec): Define the coordinates of the cell corners. Each has four elements.

Return type:

tuple[list[float], list[float]]

index_to_position(ind: int) → TwoDimArray¶

Converts a single matrix index to a position

Parameters:

ind – Matrix scalar index

Returns:

2x1 position corresponding to the point

Return type:

TwoDimArray

indices_to_position(row: int, col: int) → TwoDimArray¶

indices_to_position converts (row,column) indices into a position

Parameters:

  • row – row index inside grid

  • col – column index inside grid

Returns:

2x1 position corresponding to the point

Return type:

TwoDimArray

is_occupied(q: TwoDimArray) → bool¶
is_occupied returns true if the position is in an occupied

cell, false otherwise. An invalid position is considered occupied

Parameters:

q – 2x1 position

Returns:

False if free, true otherwise

Return type:

bool

position_to_index(q: TwoDimArray) → tuple[int, bool]¶

position_to_index converts a position into a scalar index into the matrix

Parameters:

q – 2x1 position corresponding to the point

Returns:

index: single index into the matrix

Valid: boolean indicating whether the passed in position is valid (True)

Return type:

tuple[int, bool]

position_to_mat_coord(q: TwoDimArray) → tuple[int, int, bool]¶

position_to_mat_coord converts a position into matrix coordinates

Parameters:

q – 2x1 position corresponding to the point

Returns:

row: row index inside grid

col: column index inside grid

Valid: boolean indicating whether the passed in position is valid (True)

Return type:

tuple[int, int, bool]

set_free(q: TwoDimArray) → None¶
set_free sets the grid location corresponding to the 2x1

position q as free

Parameters:

q – 2x1 position

set_occupied(q: TwoDimArray) → None¶
set_occupied sets the grid location corresponding to the 2x1

position q as occupied. Does nothing if q is out of bounds

Parameters:

q – 2x1 position

py_sim.sensors.occupancy_grid.generate_occupancy_from_polygon_world(world: PolygonWorld, res: float, x_lim: tuple[float, float], y_lim: tuple[float, float]) → BinaryOccupancyGrid¶

Converts an occupancy grid from a binary world

Parameters:

  • world – World to be converted to binary occupancy grid

  • res – resolution of the occupancy grid

  • x_lim – Limits of the occupancy grid

  • y_lim – Limits of the occupancy grid

Returns:

generated occupancy grid

Return type:

BinaryOccupancyGrid

py_sim.sensors.occupancy_grid.ind2sub(n_cols: int, ind: int) → tuple[int, int]¶

Converts a scalar index into the row and column indices

Parameters:

  • n_cols – number of total columns

  • ind – index in question

Returns:

(row-index, column-index) for ind

Return type:

tuple[int, int]

py_sim.sensors.occupancy_grid.occupancy_positions(grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid, cells: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]] | None = None) → tuple[list[float], list[float], list[float], list[float]]¶

Determines the occupied and free positions from an occupancy grid

Parameters:

  • grid – The occupancy grid to be evaluated

  • cell – A binary matrix that stores the occupancy. If None, then grid.grid is used. Must be same size as grid

Returns:

(x_occupied, y_occupied, x_free, y_free): (x,y) coordinates of occupied and free locations in the grid

Return type:

tuple[list[float], list[float], list[float], list[float]]

py_sim.sensors.occupancy_grid.sub2ind(n_cols: int, row_ind: int, col_ind: int) → int¶

Converts a (row_ind, col_ind) indexing into a single scalar indexing

Parameters:

  • n_cols – Number of columns in the matrix

  • row_ind – Index of the row in question

  • col_ind – Index of the column in question

Returns:

Index of the single scalar item number

Return type:

int
